text: Lepidotrigla guentheri is a species of fish in the searobin family. It can be found from southern Japan to the East China Sea along the shelf edge on the sandy mud bottom. It lives at a depth of 70 m to 280 m. It can grow to a length of 20 cm. == References == ==External links== * * Category:Triglidae Category:Fish described in 1879
title: Lepidotrigla guentheri
